greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Suspected permutation of nonnegative integers: a(n) = A052331(A282291(1+n)).
comment: Shares with sequences like A003188, A006068, A300838, A302846, A303765, A303767, A304083 and A304533 the property that when moving from any a(n) to a(n+1) either a subset of 0-bits are toggled on (changed to 1's), or a subset of 1-bits are toggled off (changed to 0's), but no both kind of changes may occur at the same step.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..30530
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: i = 0; for(n=1,oo,if(ispow2(isprimepower(n)), i++; v050376[i] = n); if(i == up_to_e,break));

A052331(n) = { my(s=0,e); while(n > 1, fordiv(n, d, if(((n/d)>1)&&ispow2(isprimepower(n/d)), e = vecsearch(v050376, n/d); if(!e, print("v050376 too short!"); return(1/0)); s += 2^(e-1); n = d; break))); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 17 2018
